DOC.brief_title: Enhancing Sustainable Pharmacy-based Immunization Program Two States
DOC.detailed_description: Community pharmacies unique position potential help increase immunization rate , especially among visit primary care provider regularly . This study seek increase level pharmacy-based immunization delivery . The study intervention design increase current level pharmacy-based immunization delivery foster practice change sustain intervention effect . Our intervention combine evidence-based strategy improve immunization coverage strategies overcome system barrier increase sustainability intervention time . The study focus pneumococcal herpes zoster vaccination service . Specific aim include : 1 . To compare change number pneumococcal herpes zoster vaccination administer pharmacy correspond 6-month period prior intervention 6-month intervention period intervention pharmacy control pharmacy . The pre-intervention period correspond intervention period . 2 . To compare extent immunization activity implementation intervention period intervention pharmacy control pharmacy . 3 . To compare level sustainability immunization service period 6 month intervention period end intervention group control group . 4 . To explore facilitator barrier implement immunization service . 5 . To explore factor affect patient acceptance pharmacist 's vaccine recommendation within intervention pharmacy .
DOC.criteria: Alabama California community pharmacy Must provide instore prescriptiondispensing service Must provide pneumococcal vaccine and/or herpes zoster Must plan close change ownership next 12 month
